page.title: 07Life on High West Road.
page.content: Life here is quite nice but all day you can hear banging of the Open Cast Mine in the area. There are very few facilities,no shops which means you have to travel down to Crook for most of the shopping.The only facilities we have is a playing field and some swings with a rocking horse on the nearby Barrett housing estate. At the top of the road there are few farms one called Thistleflat Farm,one called Woodifield Farm and some others. Most of the land up West Road is farm land.It was all fields until Banks Contractors opened an open cast mine to take the coal out of the ground. In winter High West Road is usually bad to travel along in a vehicle.
